alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:55PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Marshall, northwestern Red Lake, northwestern Polk, southwestern Kittson, western Pennington, Grand Forks, northwestern Traill and eastern Walsh Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Veseleyville to near Manvel to near Holmes. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Manvel, Minto and Poland around 705 PM CDT. Merrifield and Grand Forks around 710 PM CDT. Grafton, Bygland and Oslo around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oakwood, Alvarado, Mallory and Davidson. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 123 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern North Dakota.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Traill
